hint.text: Sum of exterior angles of a polygon taken in order is \(360^o\)

solution.text:
Sum of exterior angles in the figure should be \(360^o\)
But the angles \(120^o\) and \(95^o\) are interior angles, and as the exterior angle and interior angle form a linear pair,
Exterior angle = 180 - Interior angle
Hence the exterior angle of \(120^o\) is \(180-120 = 60^o\)
Similarly exterior angle of \(95^o\) is \(180-95 = 85^o\)
Now, as sum of exterior angles is \(360^o,95+60+15+x+85 = 360\)
\(x+255 = 360\)
\(x=105^o\)
